availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles D. Carr (Fayette County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married Mary B. Didlake Carr. Father of Charles F. Carr, Eliza Carr, and Willie Carr. Attorney in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850 and 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 203. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 82. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 51. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 54. Kentucky, Birth Records, 1847-1911, Ancestry, Lexington, 1855. Find A Grave, "Judge Charles Dabney Carr (1824-1875)," Memorial #79236909, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=79236909 (accessed April 26, 2017).
